metadata.title: CVE-2012-6054 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The dissect_sflow_245_address_type function inepan/dissectors/packet-sflow.c in the sFlow dissector in Wireshark 1.8.xbefore 1.8.4 does not properly handle length calculations for an invalid IPaddress type, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(infinite loop) via a packet that is neither IPv4 nor IPv6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6054` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark3 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap3 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil3 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
